thread.title: Unless it makes a real shift to the Left, Ukip will have no place in Brexit Britain
thread.title_full: Unless it makes a real shift to the Left, Ukip will have no place in Brexit Britain

author: Juliet Samuel
title: Unless it makes a real shift to the Left, Ukip will have no place in Brexit Britain
text:
C an Ukip break through? This week’s by-election in Stoke-on-Trent poses a “fundamental” test for the upstart party, in the words of former leader Nigel Farage. In the betting markets, the odds have been moving against a Ukip victory as people willing to put their money where their mouth is calculate that the party won’t quite make it.
The constituency has been a shoo-in for Labour for more than half a century and, in a normal year, a by-election there wouldn’t be more than blip on the political radar. This time, though, is different – or at least, Ukip leader Paul Nuttall hopes so.
Just weeks after taking up his party’s leadership from Mr Farage following his latest (and, he insists, final) resignation, Mr Nuttall is the his party’s candidate in Stoke, gunning to take one of the most pro-Brexit constituencies in the country. Labour, meanwhile, is running a candidate who has called the EU...
